intro: Rimacola elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic rimacola, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It features elongated, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help to reduce water loss in its arid environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to white in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sunlight to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rimacola elliptica is considered a species of conservation concern.
